Fields.DialogueText: Capitano, could I have a moment of your time?
Well, if you can make it quick. I'm a little busy here.
I mean, I can try, but isn't a moment, like a specific amount of time? Like a second? You can't speed up a second, can you? Can you make a second take less than a second?
Cesare? You needed me for something?
Oh, right! I was hoping to learn a bit about my capitano. I've just got a few questions.
I guess I have time for that. Ask away.
Well, let's see, where to start...  Oh, how about what kinds of food you like to eat?

Fields.MenuText: I'm a pretty picky eater. I don't like my food to touch and stuff like that.
I'll eat anything. I'm basically a black hole.
I don't eat. Period.

Fields.DialogueText: You don't like your food to touch? It all ends up in the same place, doesn't it? Isn't it all touching inside you after you eat it? Do you have a system to keep that from happening?
You can't be a black hole. Though I do feel myself being drawn to you. I wonder if there are other belles who feel the same way. Maybe one day you'll suck up the whole world.
Hmmm...  Are you like a plant, then? Do you subsist on sunlight and water? You don't seem green enough to have chlorophyll. How could you perform photosynthesis?
Are you okay, Cesare?
Oh, sorry, was I asking too many questions? I do that sometimes without even realizing. Silly me.
*ALARM*
Morganas.
Oh, but I had more questions to ask!
@BATTLE
Do you have a favorite color, Capitano?
What?
I had more questions. Is now a bad time?

Fields.MenuText: Actually, yes.
No, ask away.
I'm a little busy, but I can make some time for you.

Fields.DialogueText: Really? Why is it such a bad time? What could you be doing that's keeping you so busy that you can't even tell me what your favorite color is?
You're really not busy? Not at all? Shouldn't you be, though? Maybe you're slacking on your work... Are you actually inept?
Really? Would you make time for anyone that needed you? Or just me? Am I special? Oh, are you falling in love with me?
You're pretty inquisitive, aren't you?
Hmm? Oh, yes. My sister sometimes calls me Cesare Cat because I'm so curious.
Like the Cheshire Cat? Clever.
Conte di Cavour isn't just clever, she's brilliant. And she told me to never stop asking questions. I'm not annoying you, am I?
Not yet.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Cesare, what are you doing in here?
Have you eaten this? It's delicious! I needed to know how it was made.

Fields.MenuText: You're not getting in anyone's way, are you?
It is pretty tasty. I'd like to learn too.
You're overreacting. It's nothing special.

Fields.DialogueText: No. At least, I don't think I am. Would they tell me if I were? Or would they avoid saying anything because I'm the Belle?
Well, get in line. I'm not leaving this spot until I discover all their culinary secrets.
I'm not sure you ate the same thing I did. Maybe you had a bad batch? One bite of this and you can almost see the pearly gates!
So what have you learned from the cooks so far?
Not very much. They seem to be quite evasive with their secret teachings.
There's nothing secret about it, Cesare. I've made this same dish for you three times now.
And yet I still don't know how you made it so delectable. Do it again!
Fine…
They're doing something without me noticing, I'm sure of it!
Or you just want to keep eating it over and over again.
That's just a lucky byproduct of my investigation. Want some?
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
All right, I think that about covers our tactics. We should be ready for anything the Morganas can throw at us.
You're very knowledgeable in the ways of war, Capitano.
Well, they didn't make me a captain for nothing.
Where did you learn all of this?
I studied about past battles and wars. The enemy might be different now, but the way we fight hasn't changed all that much.
Hmmm…
Something on your mind?
Well... we're fighting the Morganas now because they want to destroy humanity, right?
Something like that, yeah.
Compared to that... aren't all the other reasons to wage war kind of... dumb?

Fields.MenuText: It's not that simple.
Well, I wish more people saw it like that.
There are a million reasons to wage war. And they're all stupid. That doesn't make any of them any less valid.

Fields.DialogueText: I didn't think so. Nothing is ever that simple.
Well, why don't we just tell them? Maybe we could make pamphlets to hand out at port?
A million reasons? I'm not even sure I can count that high. All right, let me grab a pen and you can start with number one.
*ALARM*
Speaking of Morganas...
Good thing we just finished going over tactics. Let's go!
@BATTLE
So, Cesare, what do you think of me as your captain?
What do you mean? You're the Capitano.
Yeah, but are you happy with me?
I don't... get it. What are you... What do you mean?

Fields.MenuText: Is there anything about me that you'd change?
Would you rather have another captain instead of me?
Do you think I'm doing a good job?

Fields.DialogueText: I guess I'd change how you dress a little. It's not very stylish. Just because we're at war doesn't mean you can forget about your appearance.
Well, what would've happened to you? Were you injured in battle? Did you retire? Did you turn out to be a traitor? Whatever reason you're not my capitano would definitely impact my answer.
I think being a capitano is a really good job. It's a better job than, like, being a factory worker or a salesman or something. Don't you think?
You're not getting it. Just forget I asked anything.
You can't just tell me to forget something. That's only going to make me more likely to remember it. I'll remember it as the thing you told me to forget.
Then don't forget about it. Just... I'm going to go do some work.
Always so busy. That's the sign of a good capitano right there.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Cesare, we've been given a new assignment.
A new assignment? Is it dangerous? Is it a suicide mission? Do you think we'll defy all odds and make it out of this with our lives? Or will we meet again in Heaven?

Fields.MenuText: Oh, we're definitely going to die.
It's nothing too dangerous. Relax.
Any mission could be our last. We should always be careful.

Fields.DialogueText: Really? You don't seem nervous enough for such a dangerous mission. You don't have a death wish, do you?
You're not just saying that to calm me down, are you? If you are, it's not going to work. So you might as well come clean.
Always? I don't feel like I have enough ammo for that.
It looks like we'll be heading to the United States. They're having some trouble along the east coast.
What kind of trouble?
Morganas. What else?
Oh, of course. That makes sense. I guess it'd be pretty shocking if you said... whales, or something.
No, we're not fighting whales.
Good. I like whales.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Here you are, Cesare. Is something like this what you were looking for?
Yes, this is great. Thanks a lot!
Anytime.
Cesare, what was that?
What was what? Did I miss something? Was it a ghost?!
Don't be ridiculous, ghosts aren't real. I was talking about that officer. Did he just give you something?
Oh, yeah. I asked him to pick something up for me before we left port. Isn't it nice?

Fields.MenuText: It looks like a gold crown of some sort.
I'm not really one for trinkets.
It's really nice. It didn't cost too much, did it?

Fields.DialogueText: Don't be silly. This is far too small to be a crown. It's just a trinket in the shape of a crown, attached to a chain.
No? Well, I love them. I make a habit of picking a new one up from port whenever I get the chance.
It didn't cost anything. I traded for it.
This little trinket is a Corona Navalis. In ancient Rome, they'd award naval heroes with actual crowns like this. See the little ship masts?
Hmmm, that's pretty interesting. Maybe if we survive this war, you'll earn yourself an actual crown like that.
You think? I think I make a crown look good. I hope it fits.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
What's America like?
You've never been?
I've always wanted to visit, but no, I've never had the chance. I don't travel nearly as much as I'd like. Always too busy defending Italy and stuff.
Well, that is an important job.
Wait, why are we going all the way to America? Don't they have their own ships and Belles? And who's going to be protecting Italy while we're off in the West?

Fields.MenuText: Yes, they have their own ships, but they're busy with their own assignments, I'm sure.
Don't worry, Italy isn't going to be left vulnerable. You're not the only thing protecting Italy.
I actually asked for this assignment. I had a little wanderlust.

Fields.DialogueText: You're sure? Did you ask? How else could be so sure? Wait... what if this is a trap? We're still at war, aren't we? Even if we are fighting the Morganas together.
You're right... Oooh, I hope Cavour is keeping watch. Italy will definitely be safe in my sister's hands.
Really? That's perfect! I've been having wanderlust forever, and just haven't acted on it!
I find myself more nervous than I expected. I've never been away from Italy before. Nothing bad is going to happen, is it, Capitano?
No, everything is going to be fine, Cesare. It's just another mission. The only difference is that it's in another country.
That's a big difference! Maybe I should write a letter to Cavour. She'd have some good advice for me. She always has something smart to say.
That sounds like a good idea. You should do that.
Yeah, I think I will. If you'll excuse me. I need to find a lot of ink. And even more paper. It's been some time since I've seen my sister. I have a lot to tell her about.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
This is America? It smells...  different. I like it.

Fields.MenuText: That's freedom you're smelling. Freedom and Bravery! America!
That's probably the harbor you're smelling. I think someone left a crate of rotting fish out or something.
It smells the same to me.

Fields.DialogueText: Freedom and bravery don't smell like anything. Do they? Have I never smelled freedom or bravery before? That wouldn't bode well for Italy. Or for you, Capitano.
It does stink a little, but there's something else in the air. I just can't place it, but it's not fish.
Really? You may have something wrong with your sense of smell. It's definitely different. Or maybe I'm having a stroke and I'm smelling things? I hope it's not that.
Damn, I really wish I could get off the ship and really see America, you know?
I'm sure it's not that different from any other port.
You mean any other port that I also can't explore? I know I'm the ship, but sometimes I feel claustrophobic. Stuck in my own body. Is that a thing?
Well, it makes sense for a Belle. Come on, let's see if we can find you some binoculars or something.
What would be the point of that?
Well, then you could at least look out and see the town.
Hmmm... I'm not sure if that'll work, but I'm willing to give it a shot.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Okay, so now take this and see if you can trade it for something else. Something really interesting.
Uh, didn't I just trade something to get you this charm?
Yeah, and you did such a good job that you're going to do it again. What aren't you getting?
Well... all right. I'll do my best. Wish me luck.
Why would you need luck? You did it before. Just do it again.
Okay? Okay, I guess.
Cesare? Did I just see you hand off that Corona Navalis trinket to be traded away?
I don't know. Did you? How would I know what you saw? I mean, that's what happened, but that doesn't necessarily mean you saw it.
I thought you liked it. Why are you trading it away?
Oh, well, I really enjoy art, but I don't really feel the need to hold onto it. I mean, I can remember it any time I like. So I just like to trade my one piece for more pieces.

Fields.MenuText: What if you forget?
That's an interesting way to think about it.
I really don't think that little trinket counts as art, though.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, then it wasn't important enough to remember. Isn't that how all memories work? You don't remember every little thing you've ever seen or done, have you?
Thank you! I like to think I'm an interesting person. That's what my sister always called me, and I chose to take that as a compliment.
Art is subjective. Isn't it? I mean, I haven't really been to many museums, but that's one of those things I always hear.
How long have you been doing this?
Well, let's see... It started with a necklace. That turned into a painting. Then I got a sculpture of a viking, but that was way too big for the ship, so I turned that into a frog-
Okay, so you've been doing it for a while?
Yeah. Wasn't that obvious? The list goes on and on if you need more convincing.
No, I'm good. Actually, that answers some questions I had. I was wondering where that viking came from.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
So there's supposed to be some terrible Morgana threat attacking ports, right? We haven't really run into like that... have we?
No, so far the Morganas haven't been all that tough.
And besides that, why would the Morganas just be attacking ports? What do they get out of it? What are they getting out of any of this?

Fields.MenuText: Chaos for the sake of chaos. They're monsters.
They must have a reason. We just don't know what it is.
As long as we stop them, I don't care what their reasons are.

Fields.DialogueText: Is that really all there is to it? They seem more complicated than that, don't they? Or maybe I'm just putting too much thought into this.
Hmmm, if only we could ask them. Do you think they might respond to an anonymous letter? No, that'd be too easy.
Really? What if they have a really good reason? Like... Well, I can't think of one, but I can't think of a lot of things sometimes.
You do have a point. It's odd that we haven't encountered any really dangerous Morganas yet.
Do you think they've moved on? Or maybe they heard we were coming and decided to hide from us.
We need to find them, wherever they've gone. It's our mission. We have to keep the coast safe.
*ALARM*
Hey! Maybe that's them now.
If only it was that easy.
@BATTLE
Cesare, you've got a letter. I never thought I'd deliver a letter to a ship.
Why? Because you're the capitano and it's a task that's beneath you?
No, I just-
Oh, it's from my sister! Cavour got back to me.
Conte di Cavour, right? You actually wrote to her?
Well, she's the most brilliant Belle on the seas. Who better to get advice from? Plus, she's my sister and I missed her. Don't you miss your family sometimes too?

Fields.MenuText: I don't have any family.
My family's horrible. There's not a good egg in the bunch.
Yeah, I can understand that. It's hard to be away from family.

Fields.DialogueText: You have no family? That's just sad. I don't know where I'd be without my sister.
Really? Wait, that can't be true, because you're a good egg.
It really is. I wish the two of us weren't so busy. It's been far too long since we've seen each other.
So what's it say in her letter?
Well, that's a personal question, Capitano. And I haven't even read it yet. Give me a second here.
*ALARM*
Looks like you don't have one.
Stupid Morganas. Always interrupting.
@BATTLE
You're better at chess than I thought you'd be, Cesare.
Cavour taught me. She'd always say that the tactics I learn from the game would be useful in battle, but that real war had far fewer rules.
Well, she's not wrong. There are a few similarities, but chess definitely isn't war.
Good thing too, because if it was, you'd be doomed. Checkmate. Right? That's a mate, right? I don't think you have any moves left, do you?
No, you're right. I'm definitely beaten. Good job.
Yeah! I've got to tell Cavour about this in my next letter.
How was her last letter? Did she give you some good sisterly advice?
In a way. It was very her. She tends to be pretty straightforward with me. She says that if she's not, I'll turn a simple conversation into endless questions. She's probably right.
So what did she say?
To be careful. And not to end up like Vinci.
Who?
Our sister. She's... in a better place.

Fields.MenuText: I wasn't aware you had another sister.
I'm sorry for your loss, Cesare.
You mean she's dead. You don't actually know she's in a better place.

Fields.DialogueText: She was our little sister. She fell before the war, so sometimes people forget about her. But we never will.
Thank you, but it was a long time ago. Remembering her isn't as painful as it used to be.
I do know. Even ships go to Heaven, Capitano.
So Conte di Cavour's advice was reminding you about your dead sister?
When you put it like that, you make her sound cold. She just doesn't want to lose me too.
She can be cunning, and manipulative sometimes, but she's really just a big sweetheart.
I suppose you'd know her best, wouldn't you?
Better than most... I hope... Unless she's changed since I last saw her. Nah, that wouldn't have happened. She couldn't have changed that much. Could she?
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Capitano, we've got a whole lot of Morganas starting to surround us.
I guess they're looking for a fight.
I guess they found one.
Yeah, and just when we were heading back to port.
@BATTLE
Those seemed... tougher than the other Morganas we've been encountering.
Do you think those were the Morganas we've been looking for?

Fields.MenuText: I doubt it. You won't have to ask when we finally find the Morganas that have been attacking ports.
Probably. I think we might be able to call this mission accomplished.
I'm not sure. What do you think?

Fields.DialogueText: You really think so? Will they have name tags or something? How will we know?
You're sure? Does that mean we can celebrate? I can get the cooks to whip up something delicious!
Hmmm... I think if those really were the Morganas, then they wouldn't have had to call us to deal with them. Then again, maybe we were just the most available? But... Hmmm…
Either way, we need to head back to port. We still need to resupply.
Even more so now after that battle. Let's hope we don't run into any more Morganas on the way there.
Don't jinx us, Cesare.
You believe in jinxes? Wait... is a jinx an actual thing? What about hexes? Curses? I think an old woman may have cursed me while I was being built. Maybe that's why...
What happened here, Capitano? The port... it's destroyed…
Morganas. We must've just missed them.
We would've been here if those Morganas from before hadn't ambushed us. We could've protected these people. We could've stopped this destruction.

Fields.MenuText: Or we could've been destroyed, too.
You're right. We should've been faster.
Doesn't seem like a coincidence, does it?

Fields.DialogueText: No. No! We could've defeated them. Right? I mean, that's why we're here, after all. Yeah, we could've beat them. If we hadn't been stalled.
Those Morganas slowed us down. It's like they knew where we were heading and stopped us.
No, it doesn't. Those Morganas didn't attack us randomly.
These Morganas are smarter than I thought they'd be. They attacked us so they'd have time to finish their assault on the port. They've made fools of us!
It does seem that way, doesn't it?
How many people do you think have been killed or injured because of these Morganas now?
More than I could count. Why?
They have to pay. We need to go out and find them. Now.
We still need to resupply.
Do you really think we could resupply here? These people have bigger things to deal with. We can find another port while we're looking for these monsters.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Capitano, we're approaching some Morganas.
Think they're the ones responsible for the attacks?
Maybe? I doubt it, but we still need to defeat them anyway, don't we?
You're right about that.
@BATTLE
Those definitely weren't the Morganas we're looking for. Too weak.
Plus, I just received a report. There's another port being attacked.
Where? They're close by, right? Do we still have time to come to their aid?

Fields.MenuText: They're close, but we shouldn't rush in. We need a plan.
If we hurry we should make it in time.
They're already doomed. We can help them, but we shouldn't expect to save anyone.

Fields.DialogueText: You're right, but can we come up with a plan while rushing? We don't have any time to waste, do we?
Then we need to hurry. What are we still doing talking? We should already be moving, right?
That's a horrible way to think about it. We need to try and save everyone!
We need to move, Capitano. There are innocent people in need of our help.
Okay, let's go. If we're lucky, we'll get there before the Morganas leave this time.
The port is still under attack. We made it in time.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe we shouldn't do this. That's a lot of Morganas.
We need to hurry. Their assault is only going to get worse if we don't stop them.
Are you ready? This is gonna be a tough battle.

Fields.DialogueText: Are you really scared? When did you become a coward? Maybe I misjudged you, Capitano. I thought you were made of sturdier stuff.
You're right! They've been wreaking havoc on these people for far too long!
It sounds like you're the one who isn't ready. I've been ready this whole time.
*BOOM*
Capitano, we need to get in there. Those people need us.
You're right. If we don't step in, they could all die. Let's go chase off these fiends.
That's my capitano. Let's show these Morganas justice!
Just be careful, Cesare.
I'm always careful. Aren't I? I think I am.
@BATTLE
Cesare, here you are. I figured you'd be celebrating.
Celebrating? Why?
Well, we defended the port.
People still got hurt. And the Morganas got away. There's no way this is the last we've seen of them.

Fields.MenuText: After a battle like that, it's good to blow off some steam.
You're taking this pretty seriously. You know these aren't your people, right?
You're not wrong. I definitely wouldn't call this a victory.

Fields.DialogueText: Well... Maybe later. I'm a little busy here.
That doesn't matter. They're still innocent people. They're not soldiers. They didn't ask to be part of this war. It's my duty to protect them.
Exactly. So there's no reason to celebrate. Yet.
I've never seen you so serious. What are you up to in here?
I'm trying to figure out where these Morganas are coming from. They've got to have a base of some sort somewhere.
And you're hoping that if we can defeat them at their source, maybe we can keep this from happening again.
Exactly. So, sorry, but celebrate without me. I've got work to do.
I can celebrate later. It looks like you could use some help.
Yeah, I definitely could... Oh, you mean you? Yeah, I'd really appreciate that.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Capitano, I think I've figured it out. I know where the Morganas are hiding.
You're sure?
Mmm...
You don't sound sure.
Well, I'm not a hundred percent. I think I'm right, though. No, I'm pretty sure I'm right. I think.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe we should hold off on doing anything until you're certain.
Well, I've never heard a more convincing argument.
That's all I need. I trust you, Cesare.

Fields.DialogueText: We can't do that. What if I'm never certain? Then the Morganas will just keep running wild and win the war. Can't you see that we have to do something?
Is that sarcasm? It sounds like sarcasm. I think. Sarcasm is one of those things I still miss sometimes.
Really? Well, thanks, Capitano. I trust you too.
Where exactly do you think the Morganas are?
Oh, right. There's a cove to the south that could make a nice hiding place. I think they're there. It's not like we have any better ideas. We should at least check it out, right?
You have a point. Let's go and hope for the best.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
I don't get it. They should be here. This cove should be crawling with Morganas!

Fields.MenuText: Looks like you were wrong.
Maybe they'll show up if we wait.
What if... they're invisible?

Fields.DialogueText: How could I be wrong? I was almost certain.
No, there'd be some trace of them here. It doesn't look like anyone has been here for a long while.
Morganas can't be invisible. At least I don't think they can. What if they can be, though? What if there are actually Morganas everywhere and we just can't see them? ... Nah, that's crazy.
Where else could they be hiding? A group that size couldn't have gotten too far, right?
Hey, are those Morganas over there, on the horizon?
Morganas?! Yeah, those are definitely probably Morganas. And I'm betting if we follow them, we'll find their base.
Are you more or less certain than you were about this being their base?
More. Come on, Capitano. Trust me. We have nothing else to go on.
I guess it's time for a wild goose chase.
@BATTLE
Cesare, I've got some bad news.
Bad news? About what?
I don't think we're heading toward their base. If we keep heading in this direction, we'll reach a port city soon.
Oh no, then... were they coming from their base? Are we moving in the wrong direction?

Fields.MenuText: Probably. You want to turn around and check?
Is that really what's important? They're about to attack another port.
Are we even sure these are the right Morganas?

Fields.DialogueText: No, we don't have time for that right now. Maybe later, though.
Oh, right! That's definitely more important! How could I get distracted?
They have to be, right? I mean, they're about to attack another city.
We need to move in and stop them before they reach that port.
I think you're right. We don't want them to hurt anymore innocents, right?
Exactly, Capitano. Let's do this!
@BATTLE
Is that all of them? That was easier than I expected.
Maybe those weren't the right Morganas after all.

Fields.MenuText: Or maybe we've just gotten stronger.
Probably not. They were way too weak.
Then why were they heading to port?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, I guess we might've toughened up a bit. I'm not sure we could've gotten that much stronger, though.
Yeah... Maybe they were just the warm-up? Maybe the really strong Morganas are going to appear behind us soon!
Good point. Could the port be their secret base? That would be a twist!
*RUMBLE*
What's that?
Oh no... I'm sensing something. A really big Morgana.
Where? I don't see anything on the horizon.
It's not approaching us... it's under us?
That is a big Morgana.
Of course! It's a... submarine?!
Are those Morganas coming out of it?
Everything makes sense now! No wonder I couldn't find it.
Come on, Capitano. We need to destroy this massive Morgana!
I don't think we have much of a choice. It's either fight or die at this point.
I hope you're leaning toward fight.
@BATTLE
*BOOM*
It's putting up a fight! These waves keep on going.
But so do we. These Morganas have caused too much death and destruction. We need to end it now!
Well said. Let's finish this.
@BATTLE
We did it, Capitano! We actually beat it! There were a few times I thought we were dead for sure, but we actually did it! Now we can celebrate!
Good. I think I could use a drink.
And we need to get something special from the kitchen. I deserve an extra special reward for finding their hidden base, right?

Fields.MenuText: What do you mean? You were totally wrong about the cove.
I think it's more like the hidden base found us.
Yeah, you deserve a buffet of delicious treats.

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe I was wrong about the cove, but in the end we found the Morganas and beat them all. Didn't we? And we only followed them because we checked out the cove.
Same difference, right? Either way, we came out on top and I deserve something good to eat.
Yes, that's what I like to hear! That's why you're my favorite capitano!
Before we do any celebrating, we need to make returning to port our priority. We're running low on just about everything after that fight.
Right... that makes sense. Do you think we might be able to return to the last port the Morganas attacked, though?
I suppose, but why?
What do you mean? Isn't it obvious? I want to make sure they're recovering from the attack.
That's very noble of you. Let's go see how they're doing.
Look at the port, Capitano! It's almost as good as new. How did they make all these repairs so quickly?!

Fields.MenuText: You're asking the wrong person. I'm just as surprised as you.
This might not have been the first time they've had to repair after an attack.
Maybe the attack wasn't as bad as we first thought.

Fields.DialogueText: Really? You have no idea? Maybe we should stay for a while and try to learn their secrets.
You mean they might have some experience in the area? Maybe they're experts at recovering from Morgana attacks... I hope they won't mind falling out of practice.
No, it was really quite bad. At least that's how I remember it. But memories can be tricky. I might be remembering it wrong. What can I really trust?
This is good news. It means we can actually restock here.
I just wish I knew how they got back on their feet so quickly.
Maybe you can ask them.
I can't leave the ship. That makes getting any information pretty difficult.
I see what you mean.
Oh, I can finally get my hands on some new art! Excuse me, Capitano. There's an officer I need to talk to.
Don't let me keep you.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Capitano, look what I got! It was a two for one deal!
Two for one with a trade? That's either a hell of a deal, or you got swindled.
Well, the officer I have do all my trading is a pretty shrewd negotiator. I'm guessing he got me a good deal.
Well, what did you get?
Look at these. Aren't they great?
They look a lot like that Corona Navalis trinket you had before.
What? No, they're totally different. There's two of them, and one of them is silver. Plus, they're bigger. Oh, and you can wear them as necklaces.
Oh, you're giving this to me?
Yeah, it looks good on you. Besides, I only need one to keep trading.
Is there a reason I got the silver and not the gold?
Well, I like the gold better. And now we match. See? At least until I trade mine.

Fields.MenuText: I don't think you should trade it. I like matching with you.
Maybe you'll have to trade it to me. I'm a bigger fan of gold too.

Fields.DialogueText: Really? Well, maybe I'll hold onto it then. If you find me something else to trade with, that is.
Oh, really? I'm open to the idea. It has to be something really nice, though!
Another pack of them? Maybe this is the last gasp, Cesare...
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Glad you got some shopping done after the fight. How did it go, Cesare?
